fast3d.complex

Interface Universe

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleUniverse

    public interface Universe
    a universe holds all the data for a panel3d in an internal storage to render
    the universes data contains
    • all Renderables
    • all lights
    • the camera to render from
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(Renderable... r)
      synchronized add to the internal renderables-storage
      void addLight(Light l)
      should be synchronized
      Camera getCam() 
      Light[] getLights() 
      Renderable[] getObjs()
      may just be called from getObjsSorted()
      Renderable[] getObjsSorted() 
      void invalidateLights()
      for all Illuminatables invalidateLight() is called
      java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
      2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
      this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
      void remove(Renderable... r)
      synchronized remove to the internal renderables-storage
      void removeLight(Light l)
      should be synchronized

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(Renderable... r)
        synchronized add to the internal renderables-storage
        Parameters:
        r - the Renderables to add to the internal storage

      • remove

        void remove(Renderable... r)
        synchronized remove to the internal renderables-storage
        Parameters:
        r - the Renderables to remove from the internal storage (if it is contained)

      • getObjs

        Renderable[] getObjs()
        may just be called from getObjsSorted()
        Returns:
        an array of all Renderables in the internal storage

      • getObjsSorted

        Renderable[] getObjsSorted()
        Returns:
        an array of all Renderables with those at first, which were most far away from the camera

      • getCam

        Camera getCam()
        Returns:
        a reference to the used camera to render from

      • getLights

        Light[] getLights()
        Returns:
        any form of light used to illuminate the universes Illuminatables during rendering process

      • addLight

        void addLight(Light l)
        should be synchronized
        Parameters:
        l - the light to add to the universe

      • removeLight

        void removeLight(Light l)
        should be synchronized
        Parameters:
        l - the light to remove from the universe

      • rayTrace

        java.util.Hashtable<Renderable,Vector3d> rayTrace(Vector3d s,
                                                  Vector3d r)
        1)on a picking-action on the holding panel3d this method is called to determine, which Renderables may be targeted
        2)on a lighting-calculation the lighting-method will call rayTrace to determine whether some rays of light my be obstructed and now some objects lay in the shadow
        this method should call rayTrace for every Renderable that is in the universes internal storage and list the Renderables which return not null from that method in a result-list
        Parameters:
        s - the start-vector of the ray
        r - the direction-vector of the ray
        Returns:
        every Renderable that may be targeted by a user clicking on the panel3d-screen and it's puncture point with the ray

      • invalidateLights

        void invalidateLights()
        for all Illuminatables invalidateLight() is called
        See Also:
        Illuminatable.invalidateLight()
